posts.author: Deathbymeteor
posts.text:
Kirablue42 : Every person deserves to be able to defend themselves, and that includes Al Franken, particularly since in this case it's mob rule and witch hunt.
Let's put it this way. I once admired Gillibrand. No longer. Even if she thinks she is doing this to help enact legislation to help victims and that is her justifications for throwing an innocent man under the bus, she and the others who are telling Franken to resign without an investigation are WRONG.
I would not be surprised if they were all secretly Russian traitors too at this point. I really wouldn't. I wouldn't ever vote for Gillibrand if I lived in her district now, and I know what she did to try and get the MJIA passed, but today shows that she doesn't believe in JUSTICE at all. Just POLITICS.
fark her.
On mobile, so hard to Quote: all properly and stuff...
I agree with the part of defending one's self against allegations of inappropriate conduct. There has to be some kind of middle ground between "swept under rug" and "public execution". This is why I would like to see All Franken step back (hear me out) and run for his seat again in the eventual special election / general election. Let him step back, pay his penance (or fight to clear his name) and ask the primary voters or the voters if MN if he has their trust and faith again. When he runs again, anyone who brings up the old allegations can be painted as living in the past, or being un-Christian, or whatever response fits.
The Dems, and the liberal spectrum have got to understand that humans are flawed. They make mistakes, and that not everything must be perfect, and those who fall short must be cast out forever. There has to be standards, but they can't be so inflexible that a small infraction (say, a dumb blonde joke) gets you an eternal label of "sexist garbage" unworthy of support (exaggeration sure, but it feels like it's coming sometimes)
Yes, the D's have to keep the high ground, but the high ground doesn't automatically guarantee victory. You can stand on your mountain of superiority and be so sure that you alone are best, but the bottom crawlers and mudslingers below can still bring you down with numbers if you're all alone up there. And then what?
There must be standards, but also understanding the imperfection of all of us.
And honestly, I think Gillebrand is keeping this loud and obvious to shore up support for 2020. Prep for a run as the real New England champion of women, without the same baggage as HRC. But someone needs to sit her down and explain that sacrificing the party for her own power is a path to obstruction at best, and ruin at worst.
"All must fall, and those who stand themselves highest, fall hardest"

posts.author: Kittypie070
posts.text:
Good nights all.
I'd prefer to depart this evening on a high note in honour of the Finnish Centennial, so....
NASA and SpaceX are targeting no earlier than Dec. 12 at 11:46 a.m. EST for the 13th commercial resupply services mission to the International Space Station. This new launch date takes into account pad readiness, requirements for science payloads, space station crew availability, and orbital mechanics. Carrying about 4,800 pounds of cargo including critical science and research, the CRS-13 Dragon spacecraft will spend a month docked to ISS.
If all goes well, CRS-13's "flight proven" Falcon 9 first stage, upon sending the payload into orbit, will carry out an experimental landing at Canaveral's Landing Zone 1.

whatever is going to go down is going to go down before any real November election. There is a reason so many want him gone. He's one of the last real voices for the PEOPLE left.
everyone else seems to be just playing politics.

thread.title: Sustainability, Vol. 9, Pages 2270: Effects of the Use of Social Network Sites on Task Performance: Toward a Sustainable Performance in a Distracting Work Environment
thread.title_full: Sustainability, Vol. 9, Pages 2270: Effects of the Use of Social Network Sites on Task Performance: Toward a Sustainable Performance in a Distracting Work Environment

posts.author: Jinyoung Min
posts.title: Sustainability, Vol. 9, Pages 2270: Effects of the Use of Social Network Sites on Task Performance: Toward a Sustainable Performance in a Distracting Work Environment
posts.text:
Open Access Article Sustainability 2017 , 9 (12), 2270; doi:10.3390/su9122270 (registering DOI) Effects of the Use of Social Network Sites on Task Performance: Toward a Sustainable Performance in a Distracting Work Environment Department of Business Administration, Chosun University, 309 Pilmundaero Donggu, Gwangju 61452, Korea Received: 25 October 2017 / Revised: 1 December 2017 / Accepted: 4 December 2017 / Published: 7 December 2017 (This article belongs to the Section Economic, Business and Management Aspects of Sustainability ) Download PDF [329 KB, uploaded 7 December 2017] No Abstract As the use of social network sites (SNS) has become increasingly prevalent, its effect on sustainable performance has received much attention. The existing literature has taken either a positive or negative view of SNS, arguing that it either decreases performance by taking time and effort away from work, or increases performance by providing social benefits for enhancing performance. In contrast, this experimental study, investigates how SNS use can disturb or enhance the performance of different types of tasks differently, thus influencing the sustainability of task performance. Based on distraction-conflict theory, this study distinguishes between simple and complex tasks, examines the role of SNS, and analyzes data including electroencephalography data captured by a brain-computer interface. The results show that task performance can be sustainable such that SNS use positively influences performance when participants are engaged in a simple task and influences performance neither positively nor negatively when participants are engaged in a complex task. The study finds the former result is attributable to the positive effect of the psychological arousal induced by SNS use and the latter result to the negative effect of the psychological arousal offsetting the positive effect of reduced stress resulting from SNS use. Keywords: sustainable performance; task performance; SNS use; EEG; distraction-conflict theory; break; arousal; stress sustainable performance ; task performance ; SNS use ; EEG ; distraction-conflict theory ; break ; arousal ; stress This is an open access article distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution License which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided the original work is properly cited. GaryO: " I’m still waiting to find out why Trump refuses to release his income tax returns. What is it he’s hiding behind?"

Did you ask the same questions when Obama refused to release his college transcripts? Or when Hillary refused to release the emails that were under subpoena? Or when the FBI refuses to turn over information about its investigation of Hillary? Or the DNC when it would not let law enforcement examine the server that was hacked?

There is probably something in the tax returns that Trump does not want us to see (or at least give the press some more ammo). Like every politician, he does not want us to know certain things about his private life. Some things we have the right to know, others we don't.

Until you are willing to condemn leftists for doing the same thing and automatically suspect that they are hiding some kind of criminal behavior every time they won't turn something over; then your calls for only Republicans to turn everything over is just hypocrisy.

posts.author: Daedalus, Stephen
posts.text:
Lest we all forget, Bannon was the architect of Trump's domestic policy. And although he was pushed out during the middle-school drama of Trump's first few months, Bannon remains indistinguishable from Trump in terms of tactics and ideology. They are the face, heart, and soul of the current Republican party.

It was inevitable that Trump or Bannon would get around to isolating Mormons/LDS as "The Other" if and when it made sense to work up the GOP 'base' into a lather. Utah is a long way from Alabama, and for all the blather about religious freedom, for certain Christian sects in the Bible Belt, LDS is a long way from what they consider to be Christianity.

This is deja vu all over again. 

Trump used African American football players as "The Other" at the rally for Moore's primary opponent, Luther Strange. At the time, only a handful of players were quietly carrying on Colin Kaepernicks's silent protest during the national anthem, with little fan-fare and zero relevance to the Strange-Moore contest. But they were an easy target to rile up the emotions and resentments of a largely White audience in the Deep South.

posts.author: stickmangrit
posts.text:
Ringshadow : Guys it snowed. In west Texas. What's going on.
/has the world ended
i know that feel. one night when i was living with my grandparents in AL during the early 2010s, i went to bed with heavy rain pouring down, and tornado warnings all around. woke up early to grab some ceral and get ready to go to class (second failed attempt at college), and my grandmother told me i shouldn't be in any rush, and to look out the window.
and i saw Snow.
not the slushy, icy shiat that clung to power lines and knocked out electricity one day a year at best in that region that i knew from my youth, but the kind of Snow i remembered from living in northern KY. i was utterly flabbergasted.
go build a snowman tomorrow if it's thick enough.

darkmythology : geom_00: kimwim: I do think half the claims against Franken aren't true.
I know I'm taking your post out of context and whittling down to this one sentence, but, I agree with you.
A LOT of the Franken claims seem forced. I'm NOT saying the man is innocent, but this doesn't FEEL like the rest. Trump, Weinstien, Spacey...those sound and feel like they are 100% true, Franken doesn't feel that way to me.
I know this may put me at odds with a lot of people in this thread, but something is fishy about this.
/Again, I'm not declaring him 100% innocent and off the hook. Franken HAS to answer for the claims that are true.
I think there's a very unpopular reality that's most often overlooked, namely that not all unwanted sexual contact is the same. All unwanted sexual contact is bad, and in an ideal world there would be zero. But the narrative being pushed that anyone who has ever grabbed a butt when they shouldn't have should be locked up as a sex maniac is ridiculous. Let's go after the rapists and child molesters first, then when they're taken care of, maybe we deal with everyone who's grabbed a butt...
"Everybody's so busy wanting to be down with the gang. 'I'm conservative', 'I'm liberal', 'I'm conservative'. Bullshiat! Be a farking person! Lis-ten! Let it swirl around your head. thread.title: Utah governor calls Steve Bannon a 'Mormon bigot'
thread.title_full: Utah governor calls Steve Bannon a 'Mormon bigot' | Deseret News

posts.author: wgirl
posts.text:
I wish I could say I didn't see this coming...

Mormons are an easy target. Trump and Bannon both know that. Republicans know how most Evangelicals and the majority of their 'religious right' base feel about Mormons. They are going to feed that hate and use it to their advantage. That is what they do.

This is the problem with looking the other way when these men were attacking other groups and other people. This is the problem with justifying a vote for a man who is an adulterer, a fraud, brags about sexual assault and lies at a level never seen before in our country. Utah's votes went to Trump.

I remember a story from my Sunday School days about a boy that was convinced to pick up a snake and carry him up a mountain. When they got to the top, the snake bit the boy. He cried out in pain, "how could you do that to me? I was your friend!" The snake replied, "you knew what I was when you picked me up."

posts.author: Great Porn Dragon
posts.text:
Praise Cheesus : Great Porn Dragon: One of the stories I heard was that he had to go in for surgery and the doctors were having some issues trying to figure out anaesthesia tables for someone who was 500 pounds of Happy French Guy, so...they asked him approximately how much alcohol it took for him to actually get passed-out drunk. If memory serves me right, the answer was something akin to "multiple Jerobohams" of wine...
The rumors of Andre's alcohol tolerance are pretty much true. One night, after a show in Reno, I watched him drink 12 bottles of red wine and a fifth of vodka while relaxing in a mineral spa. Andre loved animals and was thrilled when we worked my hand raised bobcat, Fluffy, into his persona as a giant stuck with his niece and his cat in a land of little people (think Gulliver's Travels). The bonus was since I drove a motorhome on the tour (office on wheels), this gave Andre a place to actually stretch out while on the road. He would lay down and Fluffy would curl up with him. Their snoring easily drowned out my tape player.
....I think I might well have just had my head explode into cute with this :D

posts.author: Deathbymeteor
posts.text:
null : Deathbymeteor: Kirablue42: Every person deserves to be able to defend themselves, and that includes Al Franken, particularly since in this case it's mob rule and witch hunt.
Let's put it this way. I once admired Gillibrand. No longer. Even if she thinks she is doing this to help enact legislation to help victims and that is her justifications for throwing an innocent man under the bus, she and the others who are telling Franken to resign without an investigation are WRONG.
I would not be surprised if they were all secretly Russian traitors too at this point. I really wouldn't. I wouldn't ever vote for Gillibrand if I lived in her district now, and I know what she did to try and get the MJIA passed, but today shows that she doesn't believe in JUSTICE at all. Just POLITICS.
fark her.
On mobile, so hard to Quote: all properly and stuff...
I agree with the part of defending one's self against allegations of inappropriate conduct. There has to be some kind of middle ground between "swept under rug" and "public execution". This is why I would like to see All Franken step back (hear me out) and run for his seat again in the eventual special election / general election. Let him step back, pay his penance (or fight to clear his name) and ask the primary voters or the voters if MN if he has their trust and faith again. When he runs again, anyone who brings up the old allegations can be painted as living in the past, or being un-Christian, or whatever response fits.
The Dems, and the liberal spectrum have got to understand that humans are flawed. They make mistakes, and that not everything must be perfect, and those who fall short must be cast out forever. There has to be standards, but they can't be so inflexible that a small infraction (say, a dumb blonde joke) gets you an eternal label of "sexist garbage" unworthy of support (exaggeration sure, but it feels like it's coming sometimes)
Yes, the D's have to keep the high ground, but the high ground doesn't automat ...
Oh absolutely, I see it up here too.
"We elected a left-wing government, we're going to get all the things!"
"Fark no we aren't, this stuff takes time to do properly, there's a process, and you have to allow for fluctuation, like an economic downturn like we have, or if something unexpected happens"
"But I want it now!"
"Too damn bad, it's taken 40 years to get here!"
Mum likens it to the struggle to legalize MJ. To use a sports analogy, the hard progressive wing (usually younger millenials on the coasts) acts like they came off the bench, made a run, put a beautiful foot on the ball and scored a wonderful goal to win the match, so they can celebrate their great victory and revel in the accomplishment.
Except it's really still the 65th minute, there's still lots of time left in the match, the lead in tenuous, and the defenders who have been out there the whole time already really deserve credit for keeping the game close. If the fresh forwards don't come back and help on defence, put in the work, and understand that they are part of a team, then their heroics will count for nothing, and they'll get blamed for being lazy and quitting because they didn't follow up after a brief moment.

posts.author: Darth_Lukecash
posts.text:
clodcomplex : stickmangrit: Franken's gonna be a sacrificial lamb, isn't he?
So if I have this right, the allegations are:
Forcible kiss of Leann Tweeden
Devil horns on a headshot
Honk Honk photo while asleep
1 non-anonymous photo-op butt squeeze
2 anonymous photo-op butt squeezes
1 soldier photo op boob grab
1 attempted forcible kiss
1 photo op waist double squeeze? Really?
Am I missing anything?
Now of course adding these all together and multiplying by a million still don't equal the Leigh Corfman allegation alone.
However, the forcible kisses and the boob grab, if true, are hard for me to excuse.
I'll defer to the ladies of the thread on if the sum of these offenses are "lose your senate seat" serious.
The ladies of the senate in his own party seem to think he needs to go.
That's hard for me to argue with.
But if Al wants to confront his accusers and put up a fight, I'm OK with that.
" While Senator Franken is entitled to have the Ethics Committee conclude its review, I believe it would be better for our country if he sent a clear message that any kind of mistreatment of women in our society isn't acceptable by stepping aside to let someone else serve," Gillibrand said.
If Al wishes to fight this, all power to him. There is something to be said for fighting against the tide.
But the tide is coming.
